blog.name: lisk-art
blog.title: Lisk's Atelier
blog.description:
Stina Liskow, 25, hobby artist, illustrator and photographer.

Based in Germany.

My favorite medium to use is watercolor and I cronecly hoard watercolor papers. Right now I am into Critical Role!

.

Commissions: Open

Requests: Maybe

Trades: Maybe

Any questions? Feel free to ask ❤

Languages English and German

blog.name: keeperartwork
blog.title: Art Blog
blog.description: Professional animator here! Here I’ll be posting all of my original art complete with my Keeper story, Dnd related doodles, and other fun things I happen to draw along the way. Maybe I’ll end up posting an actual animation. I do fan art but usually only during Inktober so look forward to that. Otherwise, feel free to stick around and find something new that you like

summary: Inktober/Villaintober Day 20 - The Whispered One I recently finished Campaign one of Critical Role and to commemorate, I had to...
caption:
Inktober/Villaintober Day 20 - The Whispered One

I recently finished Campaign one of Critical Role and to commemorate, I had to draw Vox Machina’s most intimidating and powerful enemy that they’ve ever faced. And in turn this gave me the most intimidating and detailed Inktober yet

blog.name: natural1fumble
blog.title: Natural1Fumble
blog.description: Natural1Fumble is a group of geeky people getting together every other week to play a homebrew D&D 5e campaign. Join us in October when our filmed sessions go live on YouTube and Twitch, until then, follow us as we begin pre-production! We're excited to have you on the epic adventure!

summary: Updates updates updates!
title: Updates updates updates!
body:
I keep meaning to come back here to update what’s going on. It turns out, being producer, director, set designer, world builder and DM is a bit to handle for one person. This project has A LOT going on behind the scenes right now, since as of this month we got a filming space!!

I actually took that “cash bar” self out, so that we just have one large space now for the set. There’s a bunch of work going into making the set something we want on film. Up the stairs is a cute loft that will be my editing desk and where crew will be, with sound and camera monitors while we’re filming, as well as the set for the Geek Girl Probs podcast that I am starting with a friend of mine.

It’s a lot of work, and I’m hoping to have the majority of it done (or at least camera ready) by January so we can begin filming. In the meantime I’m still running the party through a before-film campaign for them to find their character’s voices and motivations, and working on the world they’re playing in.

So, it seems quiet. It seems dead. It’s very, very much not. After 2 years of really hard work, we’re moments from being online and it’s pretty exciting! Stay tuned!

I actually took that “cash bar” self out, so that we just have one large space now for the set. There’s a bunch of work going into making the set something we want on film. Up the stairs is a cute loft that will be my editing desk and where crew will be, with sound and camera monitors while we’re filming, as well as the set for the Geek Girl Probs podcast that I am starting with a friend of mine.

It’s a lot of work, and I’m hoping to have the majority of it done (or at least camera ready) by January so we can begin filming. In the meantime I’m still running the party through a before-film campaign for them to find their character’s voices and motivations, and working on the world they’re playing in.

summary: The Mighty Nein really need to find a potion merchant to clean out again cause they were really good about buying potions toward...
body: The Mighty Nein really need to find a potion merchant to clean out again cause they were really good about buying potions toward the beginning of the campaign but now they’ve kind of slacked off in that particular area and I think it’d really help make some battles come off as less of TPK-y.

D&D, Critical Role, Discworld. 
-
I create meta, gifsets, fanart and fanfiction.

My inbox is always open for prompts, and I love getting them... but no guarantees.

summary: Every week that goes by with no announcements on how many episodes this ‘first’ season of AWNP will be, I get a little bit more...
body:
Every week that goes by with no announcements on how many episodes this ‘first’ season of AWNP will be, I get a little bit more nervous. Like… it can’t really be a weekly podcast/show/thing. Not really really.

I think the utter randomness of the update schedule during the original podcast have made me completely paranoid, and I no longer trust like that.
